titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Eugene Winick Papers Relating to Eugene O'Neill
Winick (Eugene) Papers Relating to Eugene O'Neill
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 05:27

did.unittitle: Eugene Winick papers relating to Eugene O'Neill

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Eugene Winick papers relating to Eugene O'Neill consist of correspondence and other papers dating from the mid 1920s through late 1940s. There is correspondence addressed to Eugene and Carlotta O'Neill from publishers, literary agents, law firms, and individuals, with large files for the literary agency, Richard J. Madden Play Company, Random House, Theatre Guild, and the law firm of Harry Weinberger. There are also subject folders for "foreign letters" and "requests" relating to permissions, translations, critical works and reception, research inquiries, financial matters, invitations, and other matters. Other papers consist chiefly of financial records, including income tax related material for the years from 1937 through 1948, investment reports, and royalty statements from Dramatists Play Service, Random House, and the Richard J. Madden Play Company.

langmaterial.language: Chiefly in English; some materials in French, Spanish, Italian, and German.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 8: Restricted fragile material. Reference surrogates have been substituted in the main files. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Eugene Winick Papers Relating to Eugene O'Neill is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Eugene Winick Papers Relating to Eugene O'Neill. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Eugene O'Neill (1888-1953)
bioghist.p: For a chronology on Eugene O'Neill and Carlotta Monterey O'Neill (1888-1970), see the Eugene O'Neill Papers (YCAL MSS 123). Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Eugene Winick papers relating to Eugene O'Neill consist of correspondence and other papers dating from the mid 1920s through late 1940s. There is correspondence addressed to Eugene and Carlotta O'Neill from publishers, literary agents, law firms, and others, with large files for the literary agency, Richard J. Madden Play Company, Random House, Theatre Guild, and the law firm of Harry Weinberger. There are also subject folders for "foreign letters" and "requests" relating to permissions, translations, critical works and reception, research inquiries, financial matters, invitations, and other matters. Other papers consist chiefly of financial records, including income tax related material for the years from 1937 through 1948, investment reports, and royalty statements from Dramatists Play Service, Random House, and the Richard J. Madden Play Company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Correspondence, 1923-1949. II. Other Papers, 1935-1949.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I. contains correspondence addressed to Eugene and Carlotta O'Neill from publishers, literary agents, law firms, and others dating from the 1920s through late 1940s. Large files can be found for the literary agency Richard J. Madden Play Company, Random House, Theatre Guild, and the law firm of Harry Weinberger. There are also subject folders for "foreign letters" and "requests" relating to permissions, translations, critical works and reception, research inquiries, financial matters, invitations, and other matters.
Chiefly in English, with some material in French and Spanish.

did.unittitle: John H. G. Pell & Company, Inc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II. Other Papers consists chiefly of financial records, including income tax related material for the years from 1937 through 1948, investment reports, and royalty statements from Dramatists Play Service, Random House, and the Richard J. Madden Play Company.
Chiefly in English, with some material in Italian and German.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Reference surrogates have been substituted in the main files. For further information consult the appropriate curator.
